intro: Baphia lescrauwaetii, commonly known as the Lescrauwaet's baphia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream sides. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
